    • Method Detail

      • evaluateClassification

        public Result evaluateClassification()
        Manages the evaluation procedure for the classification task
        Returns:
        Returns the results of the evaluation of the classification

      • evaluateF1Score

        public Result evaluateF1Score()
        This method is a compact version of the normal 'evaluateClassification()' method. It is only used by the EmoClassifier_SVM class when performing parameter search. This method only calculates the relevant results needed for the parameter search.
        Returns:
        Returns the results of the emotion classification.

      • countTweetsPerEmo

        private int[] countTweetsPerEmo(java.util.ArrayList<Tweet> corpus)
        This method counts the number of Tweets for each basic emotion.
        Parameters:
        corpus - The to be evaluated corpus.
        Returns:
        Returns an array containing the amount of Tweets per basic emotion.

      • calculateMissclassificationMatrix

        private double[][] calculateMissclassificationMatrix(int[] tweetsPerEmoTest)
        This method generates the missclassification matrix for the given results. For each basic emotion it shows the percentage distibution of the classification. For example the row corresponding to the emotion 'sadness' shows how many Tweets with the gold standard emotion 'sadness' has been classified as enjoyment, anger, fear, sadness, surprise and disgust.
        Parameters:
        tweetsPerEmoTest - Contains information about the amount of Tweets for each basic emotion in the test set.
        Returns:
        Returns the missclassification matrix.

      • calcPosNegEmo

        private void calcPosNegEmo()
        Calculates the true positives, true negatives, false positives and false negatives for each basic emotion

      • evaluateModifier

        public Result evaluateModifier(java.io.File handAnnotatedTweetsFile)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Manages the evaluation procedure for the modifier detection task
        Parameters:
        handAnnotatedTweetsFile - File that contains the annotations made by hand
        Returns:
        Returns the results of the evaluation of the modifier detection
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws exception if a Tweet in the hand annotated Tweets file is not present in the corpus.

      • createHashMap

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Tweet> createHashMap()
        Creates a hashmap containing all Tweet IDs as keys with their corresponding Tweet object as the value. The hashmap is used to retrieve a Tweet object using its ID from a hand annotation.
        Returns:
        Returns a hashmap containing all Tweet IDs as keys with their corresponding Tweet object as the value.

                                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the annotations made by hand into a list
        Parameters:
        handAnnotatedTweetsFile - File that contains the annotations made by hand
        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws exception if handAnnotatedTweetsFile can not be read

      • calcPosNegModifier

        private void calcPosNegModifier(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String[]> handAnnotations,
                                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Tweet> handAnnotatedTweets)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates the true positives, true negatives, false positives and false negatives for each modifier This evaluation method not only considers if a token is modified correctly, but also if it is modified by the correct modifier token
        Parameters:
        handAnnotations - List containing all annotations made by hand
        handAnnotatedTweets - Hashmap containing all Tweet IDs as keys with their corresponding Tweet object as the value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws exception if a Tweet in the hand annotated Tweets file is not present in the corpus

      • calcPosNegModifierSimple

        private void calcPosNegModifierSimple(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String[]> handAnnotations,
                                      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Tweet> handAnnotatedTweets)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates the true positives, true negatives, false positives and false negatives for each modifier The 'simple' evaluation method only considers if a token is modified correctly, but not if it is modified by the correct modifier token.
        Parameters:
        handAnnotations - List containing all annotations made by hand
        handAnnotatedTweets - Hashmap containing all Tweet IDs as keys with their corresponding Tweet object as the value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws exception if a Tweet in the hand annotated Tweets file is not present in the corpus

      • createSimpleAnnotations

        private java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String[]> createSimpleAnnotations(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String[]> handAnnotations)
        This method takes a list of hand annotations as input and transforms them to annotations used by the simple annotation algorithm. Three annotation lines will be created for each unique emotion word appearing in the hand annotations, one for each modifier type. Thus, the simple annotations tell us for each unique emotion word if it is negated, intensified or diminished.
        Parameters:
        handAnnotations - List containing hand annotations.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of transformed annotations used for the simple evaluation algorithm.
